intro: Rupicapnos longipes subsp. aurasiaca, commonly known as the Aurasiaca firecracker, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its striking red and orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture, and it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
